pull_request.title: [AC-1122] Add AllowAdminAccessToAllCollectionItems setting to Organizations
pull_request.body:
## Type of change

<!-- (mark with an `X`) -->

```
- [ ] Bug fix
- [X] New feature development
- [ ] Tech debt (refactoring, code cleanup, dependency upgrades, etc)
- [ ] Build/deploy pipeline (DevOps)
- [ ] Other
```

## Objective
Create a new collection management setting to allow owner/admins access to all collections and items (`AllowAdminAccessToAllCollectionItems`). The setting will default to enabled for existing organizations to preserve current behavior. Only once the flexible collections feature flag is enabled will newly created organizations default to disabled.

This PR only adds the column to the database and adds API support for toggling the setting; it does enact any behavior changes.

Related Clients PR: https://github.com/bitwarden/clients/pull/6703

## Code changes
<!--Explain the changes you've made to each file or major component. This should help the reviewer understand your changes-->
<!--Also refer to any related changes or PRs in other repositories-->

* **src/Core/Entities/Organization.cs:** Add the new property to the Organization entity
* **src/Core/Services/Implementations/OrganizationService.cs**: Ensure newly created orgs have the correct default value for the setting depending on the feature flag
* **Organization Sprocs and Views:** Add the new property to the Create/Update sprocs and Details View
* **util/Migrator/DbScripts/2023-10-24_04_AdminCollectionItemAccess.sql:** Add the migration script
* **EF Migrations**
* **API Request/Response Models:** Add the new property
* **src/Core/Context/CurrentContextOrganization.cs:** Add the new property so its available for future logic to enforce the setting.

## Before you submit

- Please check for formatting errors (`dotnet format --verify-no-changes`) (required)
- If making database changes - make sure you also update Entity Framework queries and/or migrations
- Please add **unit tests** where it makes sense to do so (encouraged but not required)
- If this change requires a **documentation update** - notify the documentation team
- If this change has particular **deployment requirements** - notify the DevOps team

pull_request.title: [AC-1696] Fix Provider permissions for Flexible Collections
pull_request.body:
## Type of change

```
- [X] Bug fix
- [ ] New feature development
- [ ] Tech debt (refactoring, code cleanup, dependency upgrades, etc)
- [ ] Build/deploy pipeline (DevOps)
- [ ] Other
```

## Objective
The `CollectionAuthorizationHandler` had an early return if the user was not a member of the org, which prevented providers from passing authorization when they should have. This PR updates the authorization handler to check for provider status of the target organization when the user is not member of the org (`org == null`); and only if they are not a provider and are not a member does the handler return early with a failure.

As a side effect of this change, the `org` variable can be null when passed into the other private methods that do the authorization checks; to account for this, the conditionals related to the `org` variable were switched to pattern matching.

Lastly, the `targetOrganizationId` variable was made a private field to avoid additional parameter passing to the other private methods now that `org` can be null and the target organization ID is still necessary in some cases.


## Code changes

* **src/Api/Vault/AuthorizationHandlers/Collections/CollectionAuthorizationHandler.cs:** See above.
* **test/Api.Test/Vault/AuthorizationHandlers/CollectionAuthorizationHandlerTests.cs:** Add tests and a helper enum/method to create multiple tests using the `BitAutoData` attribute. You cannot put `static` fields in an attribute, so I created an enum to be used in the attributes and mapping function to be used in the test body.

## Before you submit

- Please check for formatting errors (`dotnet format --verify-no-changes`) (required)
- If making database changes - make sure you also update Entity Framework queries and/or migrations
- Please add **unit tests** where it makes sense to do so (encouraged but not required)
- If this change requires a **documentation update** - notify the documentation team
- If this change has particular **deployment requirements** - notify the DevOps team

comment.body: There's no great way to solve this is there? Another way is to just stick a `foreach` loop in the test body and loop through an array of requirements within the 1 test. It's ugly but saves you from having to maintain this additional enum and mapping. I'll defer to you on it, just trying to think of other solutions.

pull_request.title: [AC-1283] AC Team code ownership moves - organizations
pull_request.body:
## Type of change

<!-- (mark with an `X`) -->

```
- [ ] Bug fix
- [ ] New feature development
- [x] Tech debt (refactoring, code cleanup, dependency upgrades, etc)
- [ ] Build/deploy pipeline (DevOps)
- [ ] Other
```

## Objective
<!--Describe what the purpose of this PR is. For example: what bug you're fixing or what new feature you're adding-->

Move organizations into AC Team code ownership.

This is as narrow as possible to keep PRs manageable, so it is just the `Organization` object and related code, not `Organization-` related things (users, api keys, sponsorships, connections, domains, etc).

It still touches a lot of different teams (everyone uses organizations!) but there's not much to be done about that at this stage.

## Code changes
<!--Explain the changes you've made to each file or major component. This should help the reviewer understand your changes-->
<!--Also refer to any related changes or PRs in other repositories-->

* **file.ext:** Description of what was changed and why

## Before you submit

- If making database changes - make sure you also update Entity Framework queries and/or migrations
- Please add **unit tests** where it makes sense to do so (encouraged but not required)
- If this change requires a **documentation update** - notify the documentation team
- If this change has particular **deployment requirements** - notify the DevOps team

pull_request.title: [AC-1286] AC Team codeownership moves - Organization Auth
pull_request.body:
## Type of change

<!-- (mark with an `X`) -->

```
- [ ] Bug fix
- [ ] New feature development
- [x] Tech debt (refactoring, code cleanup, dependency upgrades, etc)
- [ ] Build/deploy pipeline (DevOps)
- [ ] Other
```

## Objective
<!--Describe what the purpose of this PR is. For example: what bug you're fixing or what new feature you're adding-->

Move the remaining Organization Auth files into AC Team code ownership.

Most of these were already done in previous bulk moves, this just tidies up some of the request/response models.

## Code changes
<!--Explain the changes you've made to each file or major component. This should help the reviewer understand your changes-->
<!--Also refer to any related changes or PRs in other repositories-->

* **file.ext:** Description of what was changed and why

## Before you submit

- Please check for formatting errors (`dotnet format --verify-no-changes`) (required)
- If making database changes - make sure you also update Entity Framework queries and/or migrations
- Please add **unit tests** where it makes sense to do so (encouraged but not required)
- If this change requires a **documentation update** - notify the documentation team
- If this change has particular **deployment requirements** - notify the DevOps team

commits.message:
[AC 1536] Breakdown The SubscriptionUpdate.cs into multiple files (#3356)

* Move sub-subscription classes to a separate files

* Refactor the sub-class to a separate files

* format whitespace

* remove directive that is unnecessary

* Remove the baseSeat class
Added percent off to discount, removed discount from user sub (#3326)
[PM-4252] Change attachment Size to be represented as a string (#3335)

[AC-1693] Send InvoiceUpcoming Notification to Client Owners (#3319)

* Add Organization_ReadOwnerEmailAddresses SPROC

* Add IOrganizationRepository.GetOwnerEmailAddressesById

* Add SendInvoiceUpcoming overload for multiple emails

* Update InvoiceUpcoming handler to send multiple emails

* Cy's feedback

* Updates from testing

Hardened against missing entity IDs in Stripe events in the StripeEventService. Updated ValidateCloudRegion to not use a refresh/expansion for the customer because the invoice.upcoming event does not have an invoice.Id. Updated the StripeController's handling of invoice.upcoming to not use a refresh/expansion for the subscription because the invoice does not have an ID.

* Fix broken test
Fix broken test (#3374)
[AC-1685] Add ViewAllCollections check to GetOrganizationCollectionsAsync method (#3323)
[PM-2855] Add Feature Flag to Enable Autofill Overlay (#3248)
[AC-1284] AC Team code ownership moves - Provider (#3359)
[AC-1200] Admin Console code ownership - move OrganizationFeatures (#3369)
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master' into ac/ac-1283/server-organization
[AC-1685] Add ViewAllCollections check to GetOrganizationCollectionsAsync method (#3323)
[PM-2855] Add Feature Flag to Enable Autofill Overlay (#3248)
[AC-1284] AC Team code ownership moves - Provider (#3359)
[AC-1200] Admin Console code ownership - move OrganizationFeatures (#3369)
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master' into feature/flexible-collections
